title: cori-theme-vignette
text: Load required libraries run code. applied theme designed specifically CORI sets defaults.
code: library(ggplot2) library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: 'dplyr' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union library(coriplot) library(tidyr)  data("remote_work_by_ed_level") data("time_series_sample_data") theme_set(theme_cori()) set_cori_geom_defaults()

title: cori-theme-vignette
code: # Extract the 2021 data remote_work_by_ed_level %>%   subset(date > "2020-12-31" & date < "2022-01-01") %>%    mutate(education_level = factor(education_level)) -> data2021  data2021$education_level <- recode_factor(data2021$education_level,                       bachelors_or_higher = "Bachelors or higher",                       high_school_no_college = "High School and no College",                       less_than_high_school = "Less than High School",                       some_college_or_associates = "Some College or Associates")  # For Single line chart, let's focus on Bachelors or Higher Education level data2021 %>%   filter(education_level == "Bachelors or higher") %>%    ggplot(aes(as.Date(date),         pct_working_remotely)) +   geom_line() +   geom_point() +   scale_x_date(date_breaks = "1 month", date_labels =  "%b") +   scale_y_continuous(limits = c(NA, 0.51)) +   labs(     title = "Trend of working remotely throughout 2021",     subtitle = "A single line chart example",     caption = "Source: here https://www.placeholder.com") +   xlab("2021") +   ylab("Percentage %") +   theme_cori() -> fig  fig

title: cori-theme-vignette
code: data2021 %>%   ggplot(aes(as.Date(date),              pct_working_remotely,              group = education_level,              color = education_level)) +   geom_line() +   scale_x_date(date_breaks = "1 month", date_labels =  "%b") +    scale_y_continuous() +   labs(title = "Trend of Education level in 2021",        subtitle = "A Multi Line Chart Example") +   xlab("2021") +   ylab("Percentage %") +   theme_cori() +   scale_color_cori() +   scale_y_percent() -> fig #> Scale for 'y' is already present. Adding another scale for 'y', which will #> replace the existing scale.  fig

title: cori-theme-vignette
text: basic example shows make curved lines:
code: twoColDf <-    time_series_sample_data[,c("date","less_than_high_school","high_school_no_college")]  colnames(twoColDf)<-c("date","urban","rural")  df2col<- tidyr::pivot_longer(   twoColDf,   cols = !date,   names_to = "education_level",   values_to = "pct_working_remotely" )  fig <- df2col %>%   ggplot(aes(as.Date(date), pct_working_remotely, group = education_level, color = education_level)) +   geom_line(lwd = 1.5) +   xlab("") +   scale_x_date(date_breaks = "1 month", date_labels =  "%b") +    scale_y_continuous() +   geom_point(size = 2)+   ggtitle("Line Chart - straight lines") +   labs(subtitle = "Only 2 Columns")+   ylab("Percentage Working Remotely")+   scale_color_cori(cori_primary)  fig fig <- remote_work_by_ed_level[1:20,] %>%   ggplot(aes(as.Date(date),              pct_working_remotely,              group = education_level,              color = education_level)) +   geom_smooth(method = 'loess',               linetype = 1,               size = 1,               lwd = 1.5,               se= FALSE) +   xlab("") +   scale_x_date(date_breaks = "1 month", date_labels =  "%b") +    scale_y_continuous(expand = c(0, 0)) +   geom_point(size = 2)+   ggtitle("Line Chart - Curved lines")+   labs(subtitle = "Multiple Colors")+   scale_color_cori(cori_primary)   fig #> `geom_smooth()` using formula 'y ~ x' d <- data.frame(a=c(1,2,3,4,1,2,3,4),b=c(1,1,1,1,2,2,2,2),c=c(4,6,5,7,8,3,5,6)) d$b<-as.factor(d$b)  shift<-0 f<-ggplot(data=d,aes(x=a, y=c, group=b, color=b))+   geom_line()+   theme_cori()+   scale_color_cori()  threshold(f,3.5, axis="x", label="\nthreshold",shift=0.15) #> 3.5 x  #> threshold

title: cori-theme-vignette
code:
twoColDf_defaults <- time_series_sample_data[,c("date","less_than_high_school","high_school_no_college")]  set_cori_geom_defaults()  colnames(twoColDf_defaults)<-c("date","urban","rural")  df2col<- tidyr::pivot_longer(   twoColDf_defaults,   cols = !date,   names_to = "education_level",   values_to = "pct_working_remotely" )  fig <- df2col %>%   ggplot(aes(as.Date(date), pct_working_remotely, group = education_level)) +   geom_line() +   geom_point() +   geom_hline(yintercept = 0.10) +   xlab("") +   scale_x_date(date_breaks = "1 month", date_labels =  "%b") +   ggtitle("Line Chart - straight lines") +   labs(subtitle = "Only 2 Columns")+   ylab("Percentage Working Remotely")+   theme_cori()    fig remote_work_by_ed_level %>%     ggplot(       aes(as.Date(date),           pct_working_remotely,           group = education_level,           color = education_level)) +     geom_line(lwd = 1.5) +     geom_point(size = 2) +     scale_x_date(date_breaks = "1 month", date_labels =  "%b") +     labs(       title = "Title of the chart goes here.
Avoid more than two lines",       subtitle = "Subtitle goes here. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet
consectetur adipiscing elit.",       caption = "Source: source goes here https://www.blah.com") +     xlab("X Axis Title") +     ylab("Y Axis Title") +     scale_color_cori() +     theme_cori() +     watermark()-> fig  fig remote_work_by_ed_level %>%     ggplot(       aes(as.Date(date),           pct_working_remotely,           group = education_level,           fill = education_level)) +     geom_area() +     scale_x_date(date_breaks = "1 month", date_labels =  "%b") +     labs(       title = "Title of the chart goes here.
Avoid more than two lines",       subtitle = "Subtitle goes here. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet
consectetur adipiscing elit.",       caption = "Source: source goes here https://www.blah.com") +     xlab("X Axis Title") +     ylab("Y Axis Title") +     scale_fill_cori() -> fig  fig

title: Authors and Citation
text: Dashansh Prajapati. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Prajapati D (2022). coriplot: Package (One Line, Title Case). https://github.com/Dashansh/coriplot, https://dashansh.github.io/coriplot/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {coriplot: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)},   author = {Dashansh Prajapati},   year = {2022},   note = {https://github.com/Dashansh/coriplot, https://dashansh.github.io/coriplot/}, }

what: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: goal coriplot …

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: can install development version coriplot GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("Dashansh/coriplot")

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: basic example shows solve common problem: Dashanh’s workspace
code: library(ggplot2) library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: 'dplyr' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union library(coriplot)  theme_set(theme_cori()) data("remote_work_by_ed_level") fig <- remote_work_by_ed_level %>%   ggplot(aes(as.Date(date),              pct_working_remotely,              group = education_level,              color = education_level)) +   geom_line(lwd = 1.5) +   xlab("Some Time") +   ylab("YLabel") +   labs(title = "This should not exceed\nMore than two lines",        subtitle = "Some random subtitle",        caption = "This image is not mine") +   scale_x_date(date_breaks = "1 month", date_labels =  "%b") +    scale_y_continuous(expand = c(0, 0), limits = c(0,NA)) +   theme_cori()+   scale_y_percent() #> Scale for 'y' is already present. Adding another scale for 'y', which will #> replace the existing scale.  fig

what: X & Y scales with opinionated pre-sets for percent & comma label formats — scale_x_percent
title: X & Y scales with opinionated pre-sets for percent & comma label formats — scale_x_percent
text: _comma ones set comma format axis text expand=c(0,0) (need set limits).

title: X & Y scales with opinionated pre-sets for percent & comma label formats — scale_x_percent
code: scale_x_percent(   name = waiver(),   breaks = waiver(),   minor_breaks = waiver(),   guide = waiver(),   n.breaks = NULL,   labels,   limits = NULL,   expand = c(0.01, 0),   oob = scales::censor,   na.value = NA_real_,   trans = "identity",   position = "bottom",   sec.axis = waiver(),   accuracy = 1,   scale = 100,   prefix = "",   suffix = "%",   big.mark = " ",   decimal.mark = ".",   trim = TRUE,   ... )  scale_y_percent(   name = waiver(),   breaks = waiver(),   minor_breaks = waiver(),   guide = waiver(),   n.breaks = NULL,   labels,   limits = NULL,   expand = c(0.01, 0),   oob = scales::censor,   na.value = NA_real_,   trans = "identity",   position = "left",   sec.axis = waiver(),   accuracy = 1,   scale = 100,   prefix = "",   suffix = "%",   big.mark = " ",   decimal.mark = ".",   trim = TRUE,   ... )  scale_x_comma(   name = waiver(),   breaks = waiver(),   minor_breaks = waiver(),   guide = waiver(),   n.breaks = NULL,   labels,   limits = NULL,   expand = c(0.01, 0),   oob = scales::censor,   na.value = NA_real_,   trans = "identity",   position = "bottom",   sec.axis = waiver(),   accuracy = 1,   scale = 1,   prefix = "",   suffix = "",   big.mark = ",",   decimal.mark = ".",   trim = TRUE,   ... )  scale_y_comma(   name = waiver(),   breaks = waiver(),   minor_breaks = waiver(),   guide = waiver(),   n.breaks = NULL,   labels,   limits = NULL,   expand = c(0.01, 0),   oob = scales::censor,   na.value = NA_real_,   trans = "identity",   position = "left",   sec.axis = waiver(),   accuracy = 1,   scale = 1,   prefix = "",   suffix = "",   big.mark = ",",   decimal.mark = ".",   trim = TRUE,   ... )

title: X & Y scales with opinionated pre-sets for percent & comma label formats — scale_x_percent
text: name name scale. Used axis legend title. waiver(), default, name scale taken first mapping used aesthetic. NULL, legend title omitted. breaks One : NULL breaks waiver() default breaks computed transformation object numeric vector positions function takes limits input returns breaks output minor_breaks One : NULL minor breaks waiver() default breaks (one minor break major break) numeric vector positions function given limits returns vector minor breaks. guide guide    function used create guide name. See guides() information. n.breaks integer guiding number major breaks. algorithm may choose slightly different number ensure nice break labels. effect breaks = waiver(). Use NULL use default number breaks given transformation. labels Specifying overrides default format (.e. really want ). NULL means labels. limits numeric vector length two providing limits scale. Use NA refer existing minimum maximum. expand ggplot2 oob Function handles limits outside scale limits (bounds). default replaces bounds values NA. na.value na.translate = TRUE, value aesthetic value missing displayed ? apply position scales NA always placed far right. trans Either name transformation object, object . Built-transformations include "asn", "atanh", "boxcox", "exp", "identity", "log", "log10", "log1p", "log2", "logit", "probability", "probit", "reciprocal", "reverse" "sqrt". position position axis. "left" "right" vertical scales, "top" "bottom" horizontal scales sec.axis specify secondary axis accuracy, scale, prefix, suffix, big.mark, decimal.mark, trim See scales::comma_format() scales::percent_format() ... passed scales::comma_format() scales::percent_format()

title: X & Y scales with opinionated pre-sets for percent & comma label formats — scale_x_percent
text: _percent ones set precent format axis text expand=c(0,0) (need set limits).

title: Thresholding — threshold
text: description

title: Thresholding — threshold
code: threshold(gg, intercept, axis = "x", label = "", shift = 0)

title: Thresholding — threshold
text: gg ggplot object add threshold . intercept x y intercept (indicated axis) vertical horizontal threshold made. axis Axis along threshold added. Default "x" indicating vertical threshold label Label add graph. Defaults empty string shift Variable shift label "shift" units thresholding line along "y", "shift" units right thresholding line along "x"
